title: Audio player with voice commands
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to make an audio player that you can pause and play with voice commands.

Select **AudioPlayer** to turn your smartphone into an audio player

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/AudioPlayer-Item.png)

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open the camera locally.

Do the same with the **SpeechRecognition** to make your device able to recognize what you say

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/SpeechRecognition-Item.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar, move the **if** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png), and the **comparison** ![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png) components to the workspace

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Text/Text.png) on the sidebar, move the **text** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Text/text-component.png), and the **comparison** ![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Text/text-component.png) component to the workspace

Move the **play audio** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/play-audio.png), the **stop** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/stop-audio.png), and the **text** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/text.png) components to the workspace, repeat the process for the text component and set it to turn off vibration.

Put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/blocks.png)
The idea is to recognize your voice and evaluate whether what the smartphone recognizes matches any of the commands.

To be listening when you say something we will use events, imagine that a person is listening to you attentively and every time you say something he/she alerts the smartphone. Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Devices.png) on the sidebar. Then, move to the workspace the ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/event-componet.png) component and move the event component ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/event-SpeechRecognition.png) and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/audio-player-with-voice-commands/event.png)
